The Flash (Rogue 33 / Monk 6 / Shadowdancer 1)

Here's another sneaker concept build draft, not yet playtested
- High rogue (19d6 sneak attack)
- Monk 6 for Monk Speed, Improved Knockdown
- Shadowdancer 1 for HiPS

40 base AB which was as good as I could get it without ruining balance, AB buffs will be very attractive to obtain
Up to 171d6 sneak attack / round limited by AB buffs, crippling strike and your ability to hit opponents, it will likely be much less impressive in practice. maybe by 20-50% but it is nice to know you have potential in a party where you can get buffed into a monster
Getting close to 400 HP (just over 600hp with Con capped), epic dodge, +1 monk AC +8 tumble AC, +2-8 Monk Wis AC +11-17 Dex AC
Saves could be better, you won't want to tank dev crits or implosions. (hopefully you won't with your speed and HiPS). The Will save is surprisingly better than it looks with +4 to spells and +2 to mind effects
The large number of rogue levels plus human race allows me to dump Int to 8 for other stats (I chose wisdom for extra will save + monk Wis AC, its like an iron will and armor skin feat), 300+ skill points was more than enough
Spoiler3 APR / round single wielding non-kama 6 APR / round with dual wielding + haste, fists + haste (or fists + flurry) 8 APR / round with dual kamas + haste (or flurry)
He's called the flash because he can move like lightning with the movement speed cap removed then HiPS and return to battle.
Looked like an opponent I would not want to face

I think about how I can defeat my own build when I design it, assuming it can be equipped with freedom, knockdown immunity, death immunity and use UMD for mind immunity.
I would be thinking about a nice Bigby's 7, plus a few max IGMS's, or a pile of epic frost traps (Mages do get a good deal)
Dev crit or implosion might do ok but he is fast with HiPS and might be able to avoid such abilities against the fort save, which is not that high
Improved Disarm against you would be a pain, I think epic dodge would protect you on the first attempt, but you might want to go unarmed in such a situation and equip monk gloves
A dragon (they have True Seeing, and are Sneak Immune) with a fear aura who can cast Mords and Greater Dispelling would be a bit of a pain to face

Anyway that was my thoughts on taking toughness, so he can tank a bit more no save ILMS/ IGMS stuff, probably more useful than Epic Fort or another improved sneak attack, or trying to max discipline
